causal_relations.description: Higher birth rates are suggested to cause population increases, particularly in Africa.
Economic development may lead to population growth due to improved living conditions.
Cultural traditions may influence family size and thus population growth.
Policies like China's one-child policy are suggested to cause population declines.

intuitive_statistics.description: Africa is projected to have the highest increase in youth population share.
Africa is the only region with a significant increase in youth population.
Africa stands out as an outlier with a large increase in youth population.
Africa will have the highest share of the global youth population by 2050.
Eastern and Southeastern Asia will have the largest decrease in youth population.
